name: Keyword Research for Location Prioritization
description: Identify high-demand locations using keyword data to prioritize pages that align with user intent and market size.
steps: Conduct keyword research to assess search volume and demand for specific locations
Focus on winnable keywords rather than just high-volume terms
source_quotes: Keyword research can help you prioritize which location pages to build.

name: Keyword Variation Strategy
description: Use multiple keyword variations on a single location page to capture diverse search intent while maintaining low competition.
steps: Research location-specific keywords with search volume between 20-100
Prioritize keywords with KD difficulty below 40 for local businesses
source_quotes: You might want to include that keyword on your list of keywords for that location page that you're making just to try and capture all the traffic that you can.

name: Title Structure with Service + Location
description: Use a clear, keyword-rich title format to signal location intent and improve rankings
steps: Format title as [Service] in [City], [State]
Include brand name if relevant
source_quotes: Your title follows the format of the main service or main keyword plus the location you're offering it in.

name: Local Context in Introduction
description: Highlight location-specific services and unique offerings early to signal local relevance and expertise.
steps: Identify location-specific services or attractions
Create a section explaining how services differ by location
source_quotes: putting that near the top of the page is also going to be something important

name: Service Section with Local Keywords
description: List core services with location-specific keyword variations to reinforce local intent.
steps: Create a section for core services
Incorporate location names into service titles (e.g., 'Utah Local SEO')
source_quotes: we do local SEO for Utah companies

name: Location Page Hub Structure
description: Create a central hub page linking to multiple location-specific pages to expand local relevance and visibility.
steps: Build a hub page aggregating all location pages
Develop unique content and images for each location page
source_quotes: they've built out Pages for some of them but not all of them
We built out a bunch of location pages... on a hub page right here

name: Location-Specific Keyword Targeting
description: Create pages targeting exact keyword phrases combining service and location (e.g., 'asphalt paving Jansville, Wisconsin') to capture local search intent.
steps: Copy homepage template and add new location page
Use WordPress/Elementor to build page structure
Generate SEO title/meta description with keyword variations
caveats: Low traffic for niche location searches
source_quotes: "Somebody typed in dumpster rental, Jansville, Wisconsin... their page probably shows up here."

name: Location-Specific Content Templates
description: Use templates to create city-specific content for location pages, ensuring slight variations to avoid duplication while maintaining relevance.
steps: Create a base template with placeholders for city/state
Modify content, questions, and call-to-action for each location
caveats: Avoid over-optimization that could trigger penalties
source_quotes: Change this line to focus in on this city, which would be Seaside, California.

name: Image Renaming for Local Context
description: Rename images to reflect location-specific services to improve relevance and avoid duplication penalties.
steps: Re-upload images with location-based filenames
Ensure images align with localized service offerings
caveats: Ensure images are relevant to the location's services
source_quotes: I re-upload pictures again for some of these services.

name: Local Landmark Mentions
description: Boost local relevance by referencing specific landmarks or local businesses in location pages.
steps: Identify recognizable local landmarks
Integrate them naturally into page content
example_locations: plumbing near Southern Oaks Golf Club
source_quotes: mentioning local landmarks... boost your local relevance

name: Schema Markup for LocalBusiness
description: Structuring location data with schema markup helps search engines understand and prioritize location-specific content for rankings.
steps: Create JSON-LD schema for LocalBusiness type
Include geo coordinates and service-specific details
source_quotes: this page and the pages like it are specifically optimized through a whole wide range of techniques we use to rank in search engines
"John Mueller said the web is dynamic... recommend digging deep into details."

name: Google Business Profile Optimization
description: Prioritize Google Business Profile to enhance local visibility and provide essential contact info like hours and phone number
steps: Create and verify Google Business Profile
Add service areas and contact details
caveats: Avoid displaying physical address for service-based businesses
source_quotes: your company will be displayed and this is actually a service area business profile

name: Local Pack Ad Optimization
description: Prioritize high-intent keywords for local pack ads to capitalize on increased ad visibility and user engagement.
steps: Target seasonal keywords with high local search volume
Optimize for time-sensitive queries
